instructions.title: WEBSITE GUIDELINES
items: All sections are clearly marked with titles, making it easy to find the information you need.
The most important details are visually highlighted based on their relevance.
Hard skills are presented as cards that can be toggled using arrow buttons.
Most hard skills include related projects — clicking on them opens the corresponding project page.
If you see a small triangle icon, it means additional info is available for that item.
All of my projects are listed at the bottom of the page and displayed as cards with navigation arrows.
This website is built using React.

personal_statement.title: PERSONAL STATEMENT
personal_statement.text: Self-motivated Software Systems Development student with a strong foundation in application development, with several projects under my belt. Passionate about building effective solutions and eager to explore new technologies, frameworks, and optimization techniques to create great user experiences. My main interest lies in back-end development, as well as working with databases and improving system efficiency. I am motivated to learn from experienced professionals, understand how the industry works, and gain both technical and soft skills while contributing to real-world projects.

text.title: Python Django
text.description: Full Django MVT with PostgreSQL and optimised ORM, CBVs and mixins, custom auth, middleware, signals and permissions, Celery, Redis and Stripe.
text.additional_information: Experienced with the full Django MVT structure (models, views, templates, forms, URL routing, built-in authentication system and ORM), PostgreSQL and optimisation ORM queries. Used Class-Based Views and mixins, customised user models, and created custom authentication backends. Worked with both built-in and custom middleware, signals, permissions and access control. Set up Celery with Redis for background tasks and used Redis for caching, and implemented Stripe for payments and checkout logic. Organised projects with modular architecture, customised the admin panel, and managed static and media files

text.title: Databases and SQL
text.description: Relational design from conceptual to physical, CRUD, constraints and indexes, complex SQL (joins, subqueries, group/aggregate), ORM.
text.additional_information: Experienced in designing relational databases from scratch, from conceptual and logical design (entities, relationships, normalisation) to physical schema implementation in PostgreSQL or MySQL. Confident creating tables, altering structures, adding constraints, indexes, and relationships, inserting, updating and deleting data, writing complex SQL queries with joins, subqueries, grouping and aggregations. Used both raw SQL and ORM (Django), handled migrations and different relationships.

text.title: Python syntax
text.description: Core & advanced Python: control flow, function types, decorators, OOP, comprehensions, generators, async, testing, files & JSON.
text.additional_information: Confident in control flow, various types of functions (including lambdas and higher-order functions), decorators, OOP (classes, inheritance, dunder methods), comprehensions, generators. Worked with JSON, files and database connection. Familiar with error handling, unit testing, modules/packages structure and asynchronous code

text.title: C# .NET MAUI
text.description: Cross-platform apps with XAML + MVVM: layouts, navigation, styles and resources, Two-Way binding,  SQLite and date/time handling.
text.additional_information: Experienced in developing cross-platform applications using XAML-based interfaces and the MVVM pattern to separate logic and presentation. Worked with multiple layouts to structure adaptive pages, implemented navigation between different screens and applied shared styling through resources. Used data binding (including TwoWay) to connect UI and ViewModels and wrote additional logic in code-behind where necessary. Integrated SQLite for storing and retrieving local data and worked with dates and timestamps.

text.title: C# syntax
text.description: C# OOP and generics, LINQ, exceptions, file I/O and JSON, Windows Forms basics, delegates, events, partial classes.
text.additional_information: Confident in OOP (classes, interfaces, inheritance, encapsulation) and different built-in collections and generics. Used LINQ for data filtering and transformation, implemented exception handling, and worked with file I/O and JSON. Familiar with Windows Forms, worked with forms, events, UI components and basic app logic. Familiar with delegates, events and partial classes. Projects: enroller handbook, task manager

text.title: HTML, CSS, JavaScript
text.description: Semantic HTML, responsive CSS (Flexbox, Grid, positioning, media queries and animations), modern JS, DOM, fetch/async, storage, validation.
text.additional_information: Experienced in semantic markup, forms, tables, lists, media elements and meta tags. Build responsive layouts using Flexbox, Grid, positioning, media queries, pseudo-elements and animations. In JavaScript, use modern features (e.g. arrow functions), DOM manipulation, events, Fetch API with async/await, LocalStorage, JSON parsing, form validation, date handling and error management. Worked with front-end plugins and UI libraries, including Semantic UI, and have a basic understanding of React and the component-based approach.

text.title: Tools & Environments
text.description: Git/GitHub workflows, Linux CLI and system basics, Qt Designer, Blender, Microsoft Office.
text.additional_information: Confident using Git and GitHub for version control, branching and collaboration. Comfortable working in Linux environments (terminal commands, filesystem navigation, permissions, process management, basic networking tools, and package management). Basic experience with Qt Designer for building UI layouts, Blender for simple 3D edits, and Microsoft Office for documentation and presentations.

text.title: Data Structures and Algorithms
text.description: Core data structures, sorting, searching, recursion, complexity analysis and practical optimisation.
text.additional_information: Confident working with arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, hash tables, trees and graphs. Understand sorting and searching algorithms, recursion, complexity analysis and algorithmic optimisation.

items.title: Tech Shop (Main Project)
items.short_description: A full-featured e-commerce platform with multi-level categories, recommendation system, advanced search, Stripe integration, and admin management tools. Users can browse, filter, and purchase products, manage their profile and orders, or even create and sell their own products, all with real-time updates and notifications. Also there is a course system with ability to manage modules and contents.
items.tech: Python, Django, PostgreSQL, Redis, Celery, Stripe API, HTML, CSS, JS (Vanilla + AJAX), Template Tags, Custom Middleware, Signals, Context Processors, Caching

detailed_description.introduction: This is a complex multi-purpose online shop built with Django, where users can browse, filter, and buy products, as well as manage their own sales and educational courses.
features: Structured multi-level categories and brands, where each big category has subcategories and brands have their pages with ability to subscribe for news.
Smart recommendation system that suggest similar products and popular products.

Advanced filtering for products in category that based on the existing characteristics, their values, brands and price range in that category, and advanced searching for products and categories with highlighting query.
Pagination and endless scroll for long lists.
Advanced product page that shows detailed info, has custom image modal viewer and reviews tab with ability to manage and filter them.
Logging and registration with ability to reset password, stay logged in for long time and sign in with Google.
Carts with full logic, including quantity control, stock limits, coupon system, checkout, Stripe and Stripe webhook integration for updating database.
Admin panel with ability to manage each item, search and export to CSV.
User profiles with many tabs with ability to add own products, manage them and view other people’s actions on them.
Courses platform with ability to add your own courses, fill in with modules and various content, mange order of content by dragging items and enrol other courses.
Asynchronous and optimized backend with background jobs, caching, different query optimisation, automatic and manual email sending and custom commands for terminal.

items.title: Task Manager
items.short_description: A cross-platform app for creating and managing tasks and corresponding exercises for each task. User can toggle completion status, set the order of exercises, see schedule in a calendar-view format and manage it. The UX is clear with colour-coded scheduling and different error preventions.
items.tech: C#, .Net MAUI, MVVM Architecture, SQLite percistance, XAML files, Asynchronous programming, Dependency injection, OOP

detailed_description.introduction: This project shows my ability to create multiplatform apps using .Net MAUI. This app has 3 main tabs: Current tasks, Completed tasks and Schedule, making it easier to organize work, track progress, and plan ahead.
features: Adding tasks and connected exercises and managing them in various ways, such as setting deadlines, priority for tasks, and dates and order for exercises, as well as toggling their completion status.
Smart schedule page: daily view with colour-coded exercises and automatic midnight updates.
Filtering and sorting of tasks by category, overdue statuses and other parameters.
Copy & paste functionality for exercises with a buffer implementation.
UX built with XAML layouts, multiple data bindings, value convertors and validation, including async updates, real-time status changes and error prevention.
Data storage in SQLite using .NET MAUI approach.

items.title: Movie Catalog
items.short_description: A website to browse a movie catalog with search, filters, and sorting. Users can add or edit movies, leave comments and reviews, and try a random quiz. All data is displayed in a clear, organized way with validation and duplicate protection.
items.tech: JS basics, Handlebars (Templating), Many plugins (such as Fuse.js, Toastify, Slick Carousel and so on), use of LocalStorage, HTML, CSS (including Fomantic UI) and CSS animations

detailed_description.introduction: This project was created as a university assignment at SETU to demonstrate my skills in building interactive web applications with JavaScript and various plugins. The site includes four main pages: Home, Movie Catalog, Movie Details, and Author Information.
features: Add / Edit / Delete movies, comments, and reviews with strong validation and duplicate prevention
Filtering, sorting, and advanced search with reset option
Dynamic pages rendered via Handlebars templating
Persistent data via LocalStorage
Extra engagement: smooth animations and a Movie Quiz
Image UX with lightGallery and a before/after slider

items.title: Advertisement Agency
items.short_description: A full desktop app built with PyQt5 to manage clients, campaigns, advertisements, users, and media platforms. Admins can manage all tables with complete CRUD functionality (with error prevention), view related tables for each entity, while clients can add new campaigns and generate reports, and users can see advertisements linked to their media platforms.
items.tech: SQL (pyodbc), Python, PyQt5, MVC, OOP, PDF/Excel generation

detailed_description.introduction: This is a desktop app (built with PyQt5) developed as my university assignment that shows my skill in database manipulation and building a complete application for real-world data interaction. It combines several user roles, each has different rights and capabilities.
features: MVC architecture and different design patterns for clean structure, maintainability, and data control.
Full CRUD functionality for all entities with robust validation and error handling.
Role-based access (admin, client, user) defining available features and permissions.
Detailed entity pages displaying all related tables with ability to add new or existing linked records.
Automated updates of related data and entity dependencies.
Sorting, filtering, searching, and smooth navigation between connected tables.
Raw SQL queries with full SQL injection protection and encapsulated connection lifecycle.
PDF/Excel report generation and real-time ad metrics tracking.
Simple users can view their related media platforms and corresponding advertisements.

items.title: Enroller Handbook
items.short_description: A Windows app for exploring universities and related courses, sort, search and filter them, and add to favourites. Users can add their own universities and courses with good error prevention, export data to text files and see their competitive score.
items.tech: C#, OOP, Windows Forms, JSON persistence, MVC structure

detailed_description.introduction: This is an app built as my university assignment to show my OOP skills and practical C# development. This app includes a collection of universities and related courses with all appropriate information.
features: Using MVC method and OOP principles for organising code
Persistant data via JSON files
Adding, editing and deleting universities and courses of own choice with error prevention and data handling
Sorting, filtering and searching by different criteria
Exporting different information to text files
Adding notes to courses and creating favourite lists
Calculating competitive score for each course based on its coefficients
